availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Larkin J. Procter (Edmonson County, Kentucky, attorney, politician, hotel keeper, and Mammoth Cave lessee)

body.p: Edmonson County, Kentucky, attorney, politician, hotel keeper, and Mammoth Cave lessee. Bracken County, Kentucky, native. Married to Mary Eleanor Roberts Procter on October 24, 1844. Father of Walker R. Procter, David L. Procter, and James Procter. Worked in his brother George M. Procterâ€™s store in Maysville, Kentucky, in 1836. Studied law and admitted to the bar in 1841. Member of the Whig Party. Member of the House of Representatives of the Commonwealth of Kentucky from 1843 to 1844 and 1861 to 1862. Delegate to the Kentucky Constitutional Convention from Lewis County, Kentucky, in 1849. Attorney in Edmonson County in 1850. Resident of Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, from 1853 to 1856. Relocated to Kentucky. Lessee of Mammoth Cave from 1856 to 1861. Hotel keeper in Edmonson County in 1860.

bibl.p: Evening Bulletin (Maysville, Ky.), November 22, 1895; Kentucky Birth, Marriage, and Death Records, 1852-1910, Ancestry, Marriages, Lewis County, Kentucky, October 24, 1844; Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Lewis County, District 2, p. 203; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Edmonson County, p. 85; Find A Grave, "Larkin J. Procter (1822-1895)," Memorial #42902849, http://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=42902849 (accessed August 10, 2017); KYR-0001-004-0855.
